channel.title: Uploading client.jar to host?
channel.description:
Okay i use freesmfhosting.com. Also dont say this cant be done, because i have seen it on other people freesmfhosting.com and it there forum is not upgraded because it still says in the link freesmfhosting. So what i wanna know is, how would i go about uploading client.jar to that host. If anyone knows, please help me. thank you.
Also please dont waste your time posting if your going to act like a little kid, and troll.. would be appreciated.

item.title: Uploading client.jar to host?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“pkufast, post:3, topic:429622”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=532307.msg3890462#msg3890462 date=1326808669]
Make a new block via ezportal or whatever portal is used. You would make the block an html block. You can also do this by making a page instead of a block html.
[/quote]

how would i do that, it dont have an upload button. =[/quote]why do you need an upload button? the jar would go on dropbox

Read full topic

item.title: Uploading client.jar to host?
item.dc:creator: @pkufast pkufast
item.description:
@pkufast wrote:

Loveandpower:

Make a new block via ezportal or whatever portal is used. You would make the block an html block. You can also do this by making a page instead of a block html.

how would i do that, it dont have an upload button. =\

item.title: Uploading client.jar to host?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Make a new block via ezportal or whatever portal is used. You would make the block an html block. You can also do this by making a page instead of a block html.
